caption: Favorite restaurant of all time! I have spent almost every birthday at Yamato, enjoying a delicious Singapore noodle bento-box and at least 8 pieces of gyoza at every meal. My entire childhood was spent at this incredible restaurant, from graduation lunches to holidays to dim sum dinners, and I will never forget the first time I walked through those glass doors (I have so many cartoons that I drew while waiting for food on the chopstick holders they give you)! Impeccable service, and Peter is such an incredible person. If you are ever in the area, I most certainly recommend that you visit! I even have friends who have told me that they had some of the best food they have ever had here. Patio is gorgeous too, and the restaurant’s overall aesthetic is sleek and modern (especially with the beautiful mirrors and woven leather booths). If you can, I also definitely recommend sitting in the large booth near the front window (after the pandemic ends of course).
Great prices and selections! Tonkatsu ramen was hearty and flavorful. We will definitely be frequenting more.
Generally good food. Slowwww delivery.
Tried this place already with a friend and I am addicted ever since. I like the fantastic ambience and delightful food and beverages. 5 stars.
I'm really impressed with their safety protocols and barriers for picking up takeout. Food was also ready very quickly (10 min) after ordering!
This place never fails to impress. They have good dishes for affordable prices, there are no long waits even when they are full.
The rolls are delicious 10/10 for the sushi.
The lobster firecracker was AMAZING, and I'll get it any time I'm back. Solid sushi, wonderful staff and service, and a lovely, modern aesthetic.

Even though it's a regular spot, it's always the first place we go to after coming back from traveling out of town. The rolls are fat and unique, the dinners are filling and flavorful, and the service is always wonderful.

I call this marvelous  place many times  as I like the ambiance that is part of this restaurant. The personel is awfuly attentive and well trained. The service is exceptionally fast. Not to mention, the food you get is excellent. I visited more than once and I was always satisfied. The pay is reasobable. I highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends.
Yamato is our go to in park slope. Always delicious food and great service. The lunch specials are delicious and affordable.
Beyond solid Japanese.  Try the lobster roll w siracha mayo.  It's insane.
Our favorite sushi restaurant in Brooklyn! The rolls are delicious and creative, and the service is excellent. Try the Green River Roll, the Dancing Roll, and the Red Dragon Roll!
Consistantly yummy. Well priced for the area.

From the service to the ambiance and the prices, this is one of Brooklyn's hidden treasures laying in plain sight. Some of the best duck I've ever had came from Yamato; you totally can't go wrong with the lunch specials.
Foods not fresh. Restroom stinks like someone  urinate  on the floor

I just (10/17) called in my order because it was too cold to do the 3 minute walk. I have eaten at Yamato restaurant for both lunch and dinner I am allergic to ginger and soy. In lieu of the soup (full of soy) and salad (ginger dressing) I am always granted a $1 spicy mayo. Today, I called and a very anxious, Edward, denied my request and when I asked to speak with the manager he told me that there was none. When I explained I had been granted the request many times because it is a reasonable trade-off when considering the cost, he then spiraled into a monologue about me "wanting to get him fired" I explained that I "did not want him to be fired, that I wanted to get clarification" He claimed that he knew who I was (when really he was referencing another woman in my office) and that I was trying to "trick him" because I'd purchased it before. So, I decided to make that frigid 3 minute walk to ensure that the owners/managers were indeed not there and order my meal in person. Edward then became aggressive and yelled "i just work here and follow rules" Understandable Edward, but on every other occasion with reasonable humans engaged the exception has been made and never it acceptable to raise your voice on the phone and in person to a once loyal customer.
Only 4 stars because it can get expensive.  However, the brussel sprouts and edemame fried rice are fantastic!! I haven't dined in as of yet but they are efficient with deliveries.
Excellent offerings, delicious fresh food
Excellent food, excellent service and great prices!
Decent
Amazing food and service!
Twice we went for sushi here now, we are very happy with the Fiesta roll and White tuna sushi
Great food and great environment the service is quick and the waiters are friendly, I recommend this place to eat.

Two star because an older waiter was so polite, but what happened was i tried going to that little entrance by the middle section inside the place that would lead you downstairs thinking the men's room was there.But no, what i saw was trays of old, soggy precooked shrimp tempuras, and mind you this was closing time, no reason to have so much So my guess is they just re-fry them to order and feed customers days or maybe even weeks old of shrimp tempuras that they expect you to pay a lot for. Eventually a staff escorted me back upstairs to the actual men's room that was all messy with used napkins and no hand soap. Awful.
Good food and friendly service. A bit pricy, but worth it's value if you get something out of the ordinary.
Yummy, lots of dishes to choose from.
Got the chicken with the orange peel sauce! Very tastey! Also I recommend the sake
Big menu which is not always an advantage. Food was ok but not great. Service was good. There are better options nearby.
A tad overpriced, though not as much when one considers the area and quality of the food. Still, charging five bucks for tea is a bit excessive. They also lack a dinner bento box.
Great food a good price
It was nice quiet and the service was really friendly
Great good, excellent service, and well-priced. Amazing place, highly recommend.
Waiter service means well but needs to learn better hospitality skills
Great service and excellent food. Very warm atmosphere and extremely friendly. I highly recommend you visit this place of outstanding experiences.

Wow where should I begin... Took my Lady out for dinner here earlier tonight... We ordered Snow Peas and Spring Rolls to start...At the very end of the of eating the Snow my girl noticed a Bug... It was an actual Vegetable Worm "Green"... Even though they didn't charge us for it...The whole experience left an uneasy taste. I can't recommend this place nor will I ever go back... If you do please make sure you look at what you put in your mouth.. It may not be anything on the Menu.😔😷😷😡😡😡
Great lunch deal. And good food. The only reason I gave 4 out 5, because I think the food used to be sooo much better few years ago.

I ordered takeout and the service was great. They even offered me water as I waited for my food. When I finally got to indulge in the food, it was SO good. Loved it! I'll be back again! P.S. The picture doesn't do it enough justice but it was amazing! 👌🏽
One of the best miso soups we have had. The sushi is delicious and at great prices. It's an ideal neighborhood spot. Highly recommend the spicy combo dinner.

This is the first time I’ve eaten Japanese and I loved it! I’m sure my meal wasn’t as adventurous or authentically Japanese as it could have been but I’m very restrictive in my choices. I don’t like trying new foods so I tend to go safe with meats, textures and flavors that are familiar to me. With that being said I had the curry chicken which was amazing! It’s made with coconut milk, juicy slices of mango, potatoes, string beans, bell peppers onions. It’s really the best thing I’ve ever had. It IS a bit spicy, so I added a bit of extra coconut milk to tone it down for my husband and son. I do t know what dress they use on their sale but I love it. The spring roll is a little bready for my taste but again the dipping sauce is perfect. The brown rice that comes with the meal is complimentary. The only thing I didn’t like was the miso soup. I couldn’t get past the smell, and it really didn’t taste good. So in the future I will opt out of the soup.

The sushi is good enough and fresh but when I ordered shrimp tempura I was overwhelmed and turned off by the vast  breading and how unflavorful  it was. The place has now been around for years, but it could be cleaner by the bathrooms and kitchen in back.  I'll keep it as simple as possible next time.
Delicious friendly and reasonably priced local favorite

So good, cozy vibe, attentive service, amazing sushi and even vegetarian sushi options.  Love this place so much. Their backyard garden is really romantic, it makes you feel like you've stepped out of Brooklyn.
Great sushi in all Brooklyn to me
Good service, friendly very accommodating.

Minimal wait with reservations on a Saturday night. The food was good - a little pricey, but worth it. The service was fairly slow. We did have a party of 8, though. Any time I wanted a drink I had to flag someone down because we were rarely checked on. I would still go back in a smaller group though and see if the service was a little better.

We go here regularly and we think it is the best Japanese at a reasonable price in Park Slope. (There is one place better but it is in a much higher price category.) Yamato gas maintained the quality over the years. The garden is pleasant in good weather.
Food great. Atmosphere quiet.
Very good sushi and nice atmosphere
Ok food. Nothing special
I'm squeamish about sushi, but I drive all the way from Long Island for this place! Valentine roll and edamame fried rice!
Seemingly always open, they have great food and super reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and accommodating for children.

This is my boyfriend and I's favorite restaurant. The waitstaff there knows this, and every time we come in they treat us with such great hospitality and the service is always perfect: not too invasive, but enough to know they want you to be there. We will forever come to this restaurant. Also! The take out is just as good as getting it in the restaurant. They prepare everything so well and we're never left with messy take out boxes.
An oldie but goodie. Always a solid choice in the neighborhood. Mexican roll and Dancing roll are favorites. Sea bass is pretty good too.
Love this place!  We treat it like "our little secret!" Yamato has affordable, quality sushi, generous portions, and good service.  The Red River is heavenly!
Very good food. Attractive presentations. Friendly efficient service, Great value lunches!
I love it here. Definitely my favorite sushi spot. The sushi is always fresh. The costumer service is amazing and just an overall great experience!!!
Great service atmosphere and food. Will definitely go back there.
It’s our go to regular place. We really like he special rolls. The sushi is fresh and reasonably priced.  We also like the Udon soups.
Great food and reasonably priced
Best Japanese restaurant in Brooklyn, great food and cool restaurant  Wait staff and service was impeccable

The service was prompt, but this is not authentic Japanese food. The yaki-soba was too thick (more like udon), and while the avocado roll was ok the guy taking our order didn't know the difference between a hand roll and maki. If you want decent Japanese - this is fine. If it's actual Japanese food you want - with the real spices, sauces, and cuts - this is not it.
Sit in the backyard! The service was great, super nice waiter. The food was so good. Get the blue fin sushi! It was about $7 market price the day i went, but had to try to and it did not dissapoint.
The best sushi in New York City.
Delicious food, kind servers. Nice garden out back.

Me and my friends went to Yamato or lunch, we did not ask for to go or to stay but they gave us to go and kicked us out. We were talking and saying if we could just go but they said to leave. Also their fried rice was disgusting and 2/3 of the entire fried rice was vegetables!
The food was disgusting and the service was terrible. As soon as we got our food they kicked us out, saying we ordered to go, which wasn't true. The fried rice was horrible.
Great lunch specials
I have frequented this establishment 1 to 2 times per month for over 5 years. They know my family, friends and clients. Beautiful decor, great service and THE FOOD!!!! I  love this little place!
I have only had lunch here, but the lunch boxes are delicious. The service is friendly and prompt. I would love to try dinner here and will update my review when I do.
Great sushi, good service, and elegant decor. This is a good place to eat with friends or take a date.

So I came here for the first time Saturday night the food was great and so was the vibes and service. I liked it so much on Monday I drove all the way up from south jersey (2 hrs) the waitress was rude and kept walking away while I spoke to her I wanted a drink and a salad and she was so impatient and annoyed ... I asked the guy server for the manager he asked what was it in reference to I told him service .. No one came then I asked him again then he made eye contact with her and then looked at me and said it was her .... What a coincidence ..... So she came over and told me how rude in fact I was, I said because I I wanted a drink ? And a salad ? In any event the food came and it was very bland . I wasted time money and gas. Never returning .
Great sushi for a great price. The sushi size was substantial and didn't feel like we were getting jipped.

Yamato is a quiet Japanese fusion restaurant in the heart of a hustling and bustling avenue. We dined here for a friend's birthday and snagged the booth in the front window that seats 3-4 but could seat more if needed. The pork gyoza and chicken teriyaki entrees were amazing (and huge). They have a decent wine list and prices are fair across the board.
Our regular place. Delicious and reliable for dining and takeout.
Outstanding rolls and yellow curry; excellent value.
Best Sushi spot EVER!

This Japanese restaurant in Park Slope follows the modern interior formula of minimalist décor. The garden in the back is quite nice for our dinner. The weather was perfect for outdoor eating.  Our server was friendly and accommodating. The table ordered some edamame to share and start. We had a fish, rolls and Chirashi for our entrees. The trout on a bed of rice pilaf was prepared well as was the rolls. The Chirashi with the fresh fish on a bed of rice was equally as good. The portions were equally as large as only in a Chinese restaurant would serve.  As flavor goes, Yamato does a good job. Friendly service in a pseudo Japanese modern interior where portions are certainly not Japanese and where you actually leave satisfied and full.

My wife and I walked over for a date night on a Tuesday and the place was pleasantly packed.  This is a shotgun layout of a restaurant with all the tables along the left wall, but the management has made it feel more open with great use of mirrors above the bench side of the table against the wall.  The rolls were excellent as well as the singapore noodles.  The wait staff was very attentive without feeling intrusive.  If you're already in Brooklyn or looking to try something new, this is definitely worth it.
I can't have enough of this place. So elegant and welcomed. Don't let me get started on the dishes.
Very good for their lunch specials. Everything we ordered was great. Check out Yamato, you'll be a happy camper. =)
We stopped by here as the usual place we go to was closed. The food was excellent and inexpensive.

I have eaten at Yamato many times. It is about as good as things get in Park Slope, which is not saying much. (How so wealthy a neighborhood can have such consistently poor restaurants still baffles me.) Yamato's presentation masks otherwise average quality and significantly above average prices, something they can get away with given the generally poor quality of dining in Park Slope. Some of the rolls are excellent and consistently so. But the quality of the fish is definitely uneven, especially standards like yellowtail and tuna. In Manhattan, Yamato would definitely be considered below par for quality and pricing (but, again, good on presentation).
